lines.text: So your pint-sized charge here and the thing is slobbering all over her hand, not paying too much attention to you and you're able to go (stabs) and shove it right under one of its teeth that's sticking out and it starts bleeding down the blade and you go (grunts). Your dagger is adhered to the creature, not coming off, your hand is okay but the dagger is in it. Or what'd you say, shortsword?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shortsword.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shortsword is sticking out of this thing and you cannot get it out, wedging back and forth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll feel real bad if I just fucked everybody up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to-- (Siri beeps)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, Siri.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey Liam!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Hello, Liam!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hello, Grandmaster Flash.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Disengaging means--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you can jump back and it can't get a free swipe at you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'll do that. I'll disengage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, where do you want to go?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to go on the other side of Delweth? Can I do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boop, and you hop up on a chest, all right. And now we're on to you, Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I take my scimitar out?

lines.name: SAM, MARY, LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! Scimitar?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the chests that are on the wall closest to you, those five chests that are there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I move to the one closest to me and with my scimitar drag it along the face of all five of them as I run along them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your sword along the face?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the scimitar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you go (scraping).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, dragging it across the front, not trying to penetrate it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You drag it across and this jagged line goes (scraping).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You drag through all of them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the way across. You break the lock, the thin old rusted lock on the fourth one. Nothing happens.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are no longer mint in box.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my bonus action, I look at them all stuck in that stupid chest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, it's at that moment that Obby, behind you, you hear (growling) and over your shoulder, you see another one, a smaller one, but this one starts to pustulate and get little bubbles all over it and eyes go pop, pop, pop, all over and it goes (screech).

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's The Thing! Give it CPR!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It takes a bite at you, but you are so scared shitless from the sound that comes out behind you, you juke to the left and it goes (screech) and didn't get you and now it's your turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13 hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay, so eight, plus sneak attack damage, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just Julius Caesar-ed it, yeah. Oh, ten total? Okay. Your dagger is stuck in its butt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The feature that only I can do is sleight of hand on my bonus action. It says that I can try to open a trap or a lock. I'm going to try to pry open its mouth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The one that is holding Devan. It's a trap or a lock, maybe?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a crowbar, so I'm going to jam it in and try to pop it open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to take your crowbar and try to ram it open?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just enough for her hand to get out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 15. You jam it in there and pull as hard as you can. It does open, your hand is exposed, your crowbar is stuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No problem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's where we'll end that. Devan, we're on to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I pull my hand out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you can make a strength check with advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so weak, though. Natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You see bits of halfling skin on the thing's tongue and you are free. That is your action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is my action?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sad trombone)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You should run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, yeah, I will try to move away from it. I don't want to waste the spell; I don't know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know how long you'll be alive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two hours.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Tops.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to Misty Step next to Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa, what the shit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nicely done, you are now safe for the moment. Delweth, you are up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm going to use Acid Splash on the fucker who's got my rapier at the moment. I'm going to use it right by the rapier, but not on it, in hopes that I can pull it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, Acid Splash is just 1d6, yeah?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Read that spell for me real quick so I don't have to flip a million pages. There it is. No, I got it. 1d6, succeed on a--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I hurl a bubble of acid, I choose one creature within range, or two within range that are within five feet of each other. Hey, are those little bastards next to each other?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's your spell DC?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Exactly, it is five plus five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you know what? Doesn't matter.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a cantrip.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. Your hand extends out over it and glows a dark green and black swirl of color and acid goes (dripping) and runs down over its eyes and face and then washes off like water on a duck's back.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Like water on a duck's back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's an acid creature.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So acid on acid doesn't work. I wasn't sure if it did or not.

lines.name: SAM, MARY
lines.text: Had to try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And knowing is half the battle.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's right. Hey there kids, do I have a bonus action to disengage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do have a bonus action, sure.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Really? I'd like to disengage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, which way do you want to go?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I want to go, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, how about right there?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay, Obby the Rat can take them both by myself, apparently.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm there!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dren, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so if I attack a foe before they've gone at the top of the fight I can attack with advantage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Say again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If I attack a foe before they've gone at the top of a fight--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's at the very beginning of the fight if you get the jump on them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck it, all right, I'll attack them natural-like with my crossbow. 15?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus five is 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big guy or little guy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The guy we've already been attacking that had--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The big guy? You got a 20, that hits.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay and then it's a 1d6.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus sneak attack damage because Obby's got its--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh wait, I can reroll it, right, or can I not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nah, it doesn't work on the damage rolls, but that's okay. Plus three, so four and then 2d6.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't fuck me. Ten!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So 14!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Woo, eat it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What was the weapon?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was a crossbow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (grunting) It's still going, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Aw, damn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tarvis, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which one did you hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY, LIAM
lines.text: Big guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, I will go to big guy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to go to him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to go to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, you're there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I will use a dagger to sneak attack his anus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. All right, roll to attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw man, that's balls. Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten? Total?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you really wanted to get at that anus so bad, you went around and tried to get at it and it snapped right at your junk, at the last second you went oh jeez and pulled back and did not get to the anus. Okay, the mimic, having a great shot at your junk right now, bites your junk. You feel teeth sink into your abdomen, and into your junk a little bit. You take 11 piercing damage and the acid leaks in after it for five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you okay, Tarvis?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (growling) Yep, that's the end of that, now the little one (screech), it was almost a natural 20 but it wasn't, it doesn't try to bite you but a little glob of its body goes (whipping noise) and you feel a little whip hit in the air right by your ear, didn't hit you though. And now it's your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Obby focuses still on big one. Is Travis within five feet of him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean Tarvis.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He's dyslexic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're so fucked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You take your dagger and in rage for your friend, you bring it down and it sinks into the forearm of your friend.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You take two points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Things go wrong sometimes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still in the double digits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's no good, sorry! And then I will use my bonus and move to disengage and move so I'm on the other side of the big one, hopefully out of range of the little one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It goes (yapping) as you leave. Now it is Devan, your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to hop up over the chest right there. Well, I'm going to Ray of Frost the big one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The big one? You probably need a clear line of sight--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to get a little closer, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Quicker than a Ray of Frost.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I don't know what my--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your bonus is six, so 20 and add six. What'd you get?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten. The frost totally freezes the chest next to it shut. You still have a little bit of movement if you like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I hop up on a chest behind me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Over here? Okay and now we're on Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're on me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the frigging 'D' names on this list.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, so the little fucker is by those barrels to the left, yeah? I would like to move to the top of the barrel all the way in the corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, you can do that, sure.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay, and I would like to cast Poison Spray on the little fucker.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's a cantrip, I just roll for damage or--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's a con save for my guy.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, the creature must succeed on a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it does not.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay, so 1d12, what's a d12--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh a d12, it looks like a ball, it's the other one that looks like a ball.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's got it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're rolling like shit!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Did he see me, was it a stealth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think you can-- ooh stealth spell, hmm, curious. No sneak attack damage on a spell, but it does sputter and froth comes out of its mouth and it pivots towards you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not dead yet, damn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And now we're on Dren.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do I get a bonus action?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do, sorry, yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I would like to move back to the top of the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're out of movement though, to get there, hopping on the barrels.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So what do I do, I get hide, disengage--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hide, disengage, dash-- oh well you can't dash--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can dash, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's looking right at you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's looking right at me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not going to be able to hide.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I do this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It doesn't get it, it's still slobbering--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I do this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (dying noise)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It dies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so Dren.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can the big dude see me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The big dude see you? Kind of, it's got one eye with a crossbow bolt in it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could I do a sneak attack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's surrounded. This is Julius Caesar time here. Are you throwing something or are you moving over there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm doing a crossbow with a natty 20! So 25.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well I want to take my dagger--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What happened to the crossbow?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well I didn't realize I was going to kill him, now I'm in a flying leap, but that's fine, I'll take an arrow and do a flying leap down on his eye.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You pull a bolt out and go, "Fuck it," and ram it down into its protruding, bulbous purplish gums and stab it and it goes (gurgling) and vomit spills out of it and goes all over Tarvis' feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, Tarvis!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anything else you want to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to do this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah okay. Tarvis, what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to be useful in this fight in any capacity and would like to hop the chest and move towards the last remaining piece of shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dropping blood as you go.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Did he get any damage from the vomit on his feet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, his boots are already burned from acid, I think they made a nice little crust on the bottom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take this scimitar. It's not engaged by anybody else right, so no sneak attack damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's correct.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's looking at me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's got to be within five feet of his friend.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will be the engagee for everyone else and I will hit it with my scimitar because I'm such a good fucking leader. I'll roll a different dice. Jesus, nipples on a horse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What'd you get there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now it is the mimic's turn and it goes (snickering) and another gooey rubber band punches out at you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait! Can I use my bonus action to disengage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, I want to do something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to say that's as far as you get, and the little booger that came out and went (whiplash), but didn't reach you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well done, Tarvis.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now it is Obby the Rat's turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Obby the Rat would like to move in and attack, so I will take a couple steps towards him, and I get a 14.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, that hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what that's like.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's really great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven, it's not a sneak attack right? Travis is out of the way? Seven points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven points, okay, and you use what weapon?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dagger.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dagger, okay. You jam the dagger down into one of its 50 eyes, and it goes in diagonal, and this fucking knife is glued onto this creature's body. Keep track of your daggers, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will bonus action try to pull the dagger out with sleight of hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jesus, make a dexterity check at disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not good. Slightly better. Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. You go, (grabbing noises) "Oh shit." And that's it, you are staying put. Now we're back to Devan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hop down from the chests, the other direction. The ones that Tarvis ran his swords over, can I go see if any of those are mimics?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The one that he dragged his blade across? What do you want to do? They look like scarred chests.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said one of the locks got busted when he did it, can I open it up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah you do, it's full of electrum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Electrum?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Greed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I have anything on me that I can dig in? I take my cloak off and I dust it in there to see if it bites at it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, nothing's biting you, you get, I don't know, 80, 100, 120 pieces of electrum into the hood of your cloak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's electrum?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's another currency.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Unobtainium!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, do you want to move any more? Or are you going to stay here and drool on the coin?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to keep looking at coins.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cool, okay, Delweth, you are up!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, let's Poison Spray that little fucker one more time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Help me!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I am. I will Poison Spray the multi-eyeballed thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You go. So noxious gray-purple fume floats--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do I need to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't need to do anything. It needs to do something. It just happens. No, it does terribly again, so another poof of awful surrounds the thing. Roll for damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: On my butt. All right, roll for damage. What do I roll on this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you roll on that?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 1d12. Is that a d12? Five!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus anything?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do I get plus anything on my spells? Spell bonus attack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but it looks really miserable. The shape is changing and it looks more like a chest and then less like a chest and the eyes shrink back in and go bloodshot. It looks disgusting, it doesn't look happy. And we are now onto Dren.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dren, show them how we do!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did he get rid of my shortsword? Do I have my shortsword?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's sitting there sticking out of him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll kill him with my crossbow. 15?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 15 hits. Roll for damage plus sneak attack damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Four and then sneak attack. Eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You coolly go (crossbow bolt firing) (gurgling screams).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: MVP! (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: MVP!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Both chests down.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you guys want to hear haikus?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd love to hear a haiku. Do you have one ready for us?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I killed all the chest...s. They are now all dead. So I am the best, y'all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the room falls quiet, there are two slobbery disgusting messes with daggers and your shortsword is sticking out of it and you're surrounded by money.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I race over to Devan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, guys! That was really scary, I'm sorry about that, Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he cares?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I insight check him. I know he's full of shit. Can I insight check him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will kill her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't you roll against it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it, insight or wisdom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Insight.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Wisdom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do straight charisma. I'm sure I'm fudging it, but eh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't even have a thing for that.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Zero so it's five.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I know if he's full of shit? Were you lying or were you telling the truth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you're the only one that knows where the shit in this house is, so I was telling the truth. Are you okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They've never been monsters before. It's just been actual chests of gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice, good to know. What's in the chest?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What chest? Which one? All of them? Gold!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The one right in front of you, what's that currency?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's electrum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know what that is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a different value than gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like more than platinum?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, less than gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's not as good as gold.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: More than sterling, less than gold?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like a nickel to a quarter!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glad you're all right, do us a favor: remember that thing we said about gambling with our lives?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's two strikes, I'm throwing that out there. That's two. I'm keeping score.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to kill me and you'll never get the--? Do you want to kill me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I wouldn't tempt her--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, guys! There's a bunch of chests we haven't opened here, right? Let's check what's in the chests!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are here to get a large jewel. Not gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But maybe she's keeping the jewel in one of the chests.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dren, I promise we will fill our pockets on the way out because this will certainly be the way that we leave, fair enough? We don't want to have a little jingle-jangle--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe the mimic has the thing inside of it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I go over and try to free my rapier from the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it takes like a minute and a half, but without the thing trying to bite you, you are able to plant your foot on it, just the edge, the corner of your boot and pull for a while and it does come free.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Other than the-- shit, sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's okay, it smells bad.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's still acid on it or is it just glop?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean it's not as pretty as when you got it at the shop, but it's functional.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Other than the chests in the room, are there any bookcases, or other paperwork like there was in the other room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In here there are shelves lining these walls as well, and there's clay pots with more coins in them, and you see a tray with ingots, it looks like gold. There's bolts of very fine fabric. You open one box that is full of precious stones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a big emerald in there? Is that the stone you're looking for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you like to check?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Box is about this big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I don't think this is the one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. How about we each get one of those nice, pretty stones, and then we don't reach in any more booty until we leave? How about that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't think the jewel's in any of these chests?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It really would be smart to look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Let's search the chests.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll search the room for the jewel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Check them for traps before you open them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'll check the barrels that I was standing on for traps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anyone who wants to check, make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no other doors, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is another door.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the interest of time, you all fan out, open everything you can find, drag your hand through chests full of wealth. There is a lot of money here. There is no giant emerald.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pocket as much as I can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit. Six. Damn it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coins are spilling around your feet going (clinking).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obby?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do me a favor. Will you cut some holes in all of her pockets, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, come on!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I retrieve my disgusting daggers from the beast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three minutes later they come out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I poke little holes all over. What are you wearing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really nice, awesome clothes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No armor or anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's wearing some above-average robes and a nice fur-lined cloak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And it all has little holes in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it! This was worth a lot of money!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll win it back.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I go over and grab a ruby out of that box. I search for a ruby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Obviously?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah. You said we could all take one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So I did. I'm taking a ruby. That big, I find one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Biggest one in the box.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I move to the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Are we moving out?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're checking it for traps and seeing if it's locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do you want me to Mage Hand the door?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I grab my shortsword before all of this, also.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look around the room for the rat symbol anywhere?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you make a perception check already?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was looking for the jewel before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Natural 20!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a plain room full of money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it, what a damn waste of a 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So if you have been to the basement, then you're obviously familiar with this room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the basement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is the basement?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the basement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what's next?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Upstairs. You know, the entryway, and then--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's been a while, think about it. Above here is your grandmother's office. The office leads to the rest of the first floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute. Those bookshelves-- Delweth, will you pull those away from the wall?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Of course. I check them for traps? We've already done that. I pull away the bookshelves, see if there's anything behind them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Things spill off, a couple of things break as they hit the ground. Just a plain wall behind it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's nothing there, Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The floor is stone? Wood?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is wood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, if it's not in here, the only other place that I can think of that it would be-- (groans)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is down the hallway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What room is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's upstairs. Up-up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does this door lead upstairs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yeah. I mean, it's the basement. Where else is it going to lead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The wine cellar?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It leads to her office.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. I check the door for traps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well you checked already, you didn't find any.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'll Mage Hand the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. The door goes (squeak). It is not locked, it is not trapped that you can tell.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Pecking order. Who wants to go first?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want me to scout, boss?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, Dren.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Stealthily, it's a million. 34.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. And you're in the lead, Dren? Did I hear that right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm scouting it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you're going up ahead?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You see a ragged hydra doll with a couple of heads ripped away, and it looks like it's been whipped around ragged. There's a crude leather ball made out of leather fabric wrapped up, and that's this side of the room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I skitter back to everyone and I go, Devan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does your grandma like dogs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does my grandma like dogs?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like own them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She didn't have dogs when you lived here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, like, well, I mean not that I know of. Why?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because there's a bunch of beds with really big bones and stuff ripped apart up there. Like there's a bunch of dogs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well my grandma is

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like they look like they're big dogs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't see any up there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, but there's a big bone, and a thing with its head ripped off. It doesn't look very good. And a pretty thing in the middle, but I am mostly worried about the dogs.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What pretty thing in the middle?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a brass pillar with like constellations winding up it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Huh. What do you think? What's your judgment in all of this?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Looks like there's probably a bunch of scary dogs there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: But they're not in the room?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Did you see any other doors, did you see anything shut? Did you see...?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did I?

lines.name: LIAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Should we stealth up and see what happens? I'm so sorry, I leave it to you, my fearless leader.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You read my mind, we're certainly not going to find anything in here. What is the floor made of in the room that she looked at?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you up there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go to the doorway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Doorway then stairs up out of this basement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you're going up to the top of the stairs?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aside from the dog beds, it looks like a very beautiful room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I see any animal hair, or any saliva dried on the floor, any claw marks?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 14? Yeah, on the dog beds you do see very short, not a lot, and not long hairs, like short hair. Bristly almost.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the ceiling? Can I see the ceiling at all? How high is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh it's like 20 feet up. It's a very beautiful room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No light fixtures, no chandeliers?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a couple on this side of the room, there's two of these floating globes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I step into the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You see a large, beautiful desk. First thing you see are two double doors that enter here, and then there is a very impressive full-sized desk facing that, there is a little wooden chair. Like coming in for the interview.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So the desk is in the middle of the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, if it's a long room, and coming up here is where the dog beds are, and the column, and then here's the middle with this desk, and the entrance, and then further over this way there's more. But it's a beautiful desk, and the chair, it's like a miniature throne with little wooden steps up the side of it, and you can see the seat is higher than you would think it would be, for you at least. And there's a beautiful globe in a brass fixture on one side of the desk. On the other side is a bookstand, like a bible stand if you've ever seen one with a huge book with red ink in it and a red ribbon hanging down. The binding of it looks tan-colored, maybe leather. There's a huge table on the far end of the room with papers scattered all over it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any windows or doors in this room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The rain is still coming down in sheets. They're like ship porthole windows, circular, two of them on the side you came up on. The rain is (crashing) against the side of it, all the way across the room. Same right behind you where you came up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obby, will you come up here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I come into the room and see the dog beds, and I stop at the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do you feel about dogs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know why they call me Obby the Rat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hate dogs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you do me a favor and inspect those dog beds and see what you can make of that bronze column?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Obby would rather not, but I will for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's love, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I owe you for spilling acid. Hey, do you need some health, or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm good, why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're bleeding from your eyes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the color of my perspiration.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will go and inspect the dog beds, is that what I've been commissioned to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, take Delweth with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't need her.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: One night, that's all, you know, after one night--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What am I doing? I'm checking the dog beds for traps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You poke at them. They're soft, comfortable, warm, they smell mildly like pee.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I will sniff around and see if I can smell any animals.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's dog toys sitting around here; it does smell like dog in the room. The house is quiet, other than the rain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Time is of the essence, we should move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should. Delweth, Dren, Devan, will you come here?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What can we do for you, Tarvis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Delweth, will you secure the room, and see if there are any small dog doors that would open and surprise us in a very nasty way? Will you check the perimeter of the room? Dren and Devan, shall we make our way to that lovely desk?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your hesitation?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know why you want to check a desk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, you're looking for an emerald, right? A big fat one?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I do an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She gave you judgy face.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is that what I do? I want to insight check

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That would be a three. Do I add anything to it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you add two.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That would be a five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a roll and add your charisma bonus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would have to roll, like, nothing, because-- ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Great. Clobbered. Yeah, I don't know.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I do want to check out the bronze thing in the center.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. You check out the column first. It's beautifully made of brass. It's very ornate.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No holes, I can't detect anything on the sides, no levers? Any constellations I can push things into?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you fiddle with it for a minute. It does seem strange in the middle of a room. It doesn't look like it's supporting anything.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And there's nothing at the top? It goes floor to ceiling?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Meets at the ceiling. In fact, it looks like it goes into the ceiling.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We might want to check that if we go up another story, see if we find it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And there's no balcony, riser, second level, or anything in this room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In this room? Not in this room.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, then I check the walls for doggy doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. You don't find dog doors. You do find a wet bar hidden off to the side, on the other side of where the-- yeah, old lady don't play. And there's paper, you take a cursory glance at the papers scattered on the large, long table, chairs around it. There's an invitation from a Lord and Lady Caldouin for a literary salon.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Nothing in the wet bar?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plenty in the wet bar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obby, help Delweth with the wet bar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gladly.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What's your poison, Obby?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vodka.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what that is, but there's elven wine, there's firewater.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I take a bottle of elven wine and put it in my satchel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not interested.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While they're looking at that, can I look at the big book in the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. What languages do you speak?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. Halfling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't read it, then. It is beautiful, but a little unsettling.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if we busted open that pillar? Can we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's made out of solid brass.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it solid brass? Is it hollow? Can we tell that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think the pillar probably supports the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it always there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think he said it didn't seem like it supports anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't remember that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to go knock on it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Can I knock on it? Clunk clunk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (hollow ringing)

lines.name: ASHLEY, TRAVIS
lines.text: It's hollow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The metal felt thick to the hit.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We could try some acid on it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Devan, to the desk, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you want me to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Search it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You go through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's more "flapjack," more "whisper." "Tiddlywink" is a name that shows up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Overbite, shortstack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No keys, no books, no binders?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Woodchuck. Gray squirrel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any keys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Books or binders?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's quills, an empty journal, the equivalent in Emon of a Farmer's Almanac talking about the cycles of the moon and weather.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: An almanac? I'll take the almanac.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do you remember your grandmother having any celestial connection? She's a wizard?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's a sorcerer. Just like me! Only stronger. Look, you guys want a jewel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have me here. I don't why you're not listening to me. It's going to be upstairs!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You stuck your hand in the thing and we had to fight that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but those weren't there before, you know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I check the underside of the desk and the chair for hidden switches?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, make a perception check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What book was she looking at?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not finding anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pick up the book.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The big book? Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What language is it, Tarvis?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What languages do you speak?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Common and Orc.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Elvish and Dwarven. Fuck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The globe is a planet globe, or is it an orb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a planet globe, and you can't read what's on that, either. You spin it around, look at it for a while, you do recognize the coast of Emon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I open up the almanac and flip through the pages really fast, are there any markings or things that are circled, or anything that might be a cypher or codex for the letters? No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Has anyone done a perception check on the pillar?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I did investigation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anyone can try anything, and someone could succeed where someone else failed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Want to give it a whack?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure. Maybe I'll get a natty 20 on this roll. Sure didn't. It's a seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You go, "I, I, I, want the knife."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You knocked on it; it's hollow?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's hollow.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's hollow, all right. Do you want me to try some acid and see if it'll melt the bronze? Or we could move on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It doesn't seem like it may have a support function. All right, lead the way, Devan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right! And I walk towards the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know how big the house is. You're on the back side of the house. You know that through those double doors is the main hallway of the first floor. There's other rooms in the house; there's a kitchen, dining room, library, and sitting room for guests. Out at the front of the house are where the twin sets of staircases are that lead up to the second floor, to your old bedroom, and to the hall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The hall. The room. Can I lead them there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you going to go on a little march?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we? Do you trust me?

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM, MARY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want a jewel?

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Let's go to the doors. I inspect the doors to see if there any traps and go stealth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's better. 15.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You trace your fingers lightly along the edges of the door, look for the telltale signs that you all have trained to find. You don't see anything.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is the door unlocked?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Mage Hand to open the door very slowly, just the right side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're looking in. The only light is coming from this room, but a dark long hallway that stretches about 80 feet.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How far does my darkvision reach?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60ish.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I see nothing within 60 feet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you see some potted plants and a nice red carpet disappearing a little bit into the darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you hear dogs?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I don't hear any dogs, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is this the hallway you were talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. This is a hall, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true! Should we walk down it?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'll go in the lead this time. Again with my rapier out. Is that all right with you, Tarvis, if I take the lead in this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to send some lights down the hallway?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Not right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will take the rear. I do not like dogs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody make a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You quietly move your way down, this one bumps a potted plant on the way--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that dog?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You continue on, you eventually meet another set of doors, just like the ones you went through. You know this leads to the front of the house.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What's through there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The foyer.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Again, I'll take Mage Hand and go along the edge of the door, checking for traps--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Perception. 18.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tickle the door open with this spectral hand, sticks its pinkie into the keyhole. Seems fine, nothing's happening.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Tarvis, it seems like the door's clear. What do you want me to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be my guest.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Again, I use Mage Hand on the right door, if there are two, is it two or one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's two. You see the red carpet actually continues into the next room, and you can barely see two sets of stairways coming down along the sides of this path and this carpet. You can see a very beautiful set of large doors with circular windows, one on each side, and you see the rain coming down. You also can make out a person at a distance walking by--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Outside?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About ten or 15 feet, yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is there someone outside?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You see a coat tree right by the door, and then a little table to the other side of it with a pair of white gloves sitting on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Do you hear any dogs?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I hear no dogs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Painting of some old halfling man with a curly little moustache-

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obby, check the painting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Behind the painting? (groans) I hate art.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know why the call me Obby the Rat?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I look behind the painting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's nothing there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a man looking through the eyeholes of the painting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you kill him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he seemed okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I trust your judgment.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So no doors, no nothing? It's two stairways going up and two big doors, but what's on the right and left?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a door on the side of this room, and on the other side as well. There's stairs leading up to it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you know who that guy would be, Devan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, probably a guard.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Devan, give us a layout. What's on the right, on the left, up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, off the top of your head! Quick! Quick!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's been ten years.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a library on the right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a library on the right. And then on the left is a little sitting area. And then upstairs-- It's been a while. So unless she rearranged, upstairs--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You lived here as a child, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. My mom, she split. My grandma took me in. She was a horrible person though.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How long did you live here for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Couple years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Devan? Family is very important.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should not have stolen from yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She doesn't even pay attention to how much is down there! It's ridiculous!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you want attention there's other ways of finding it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that a come on, or are we--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have a haiku for this, Dren?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is her bedroom upstairs?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Her bedroom is on the third floor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So my bedroom used to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a guest bedroom up there too, and the funtime hall is up there as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then there's this room. I mean, it could be in there. I'm thinking it's probably in there, because there was this cabinet that I never got to look in. I feel like that's where it would be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In which room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the funroom. Then upstairs from that is my grandma's bedroom, which I guess it could be in there as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This might be a strange question. Why is it called the funroom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, because that's where she keeps all her magic stuff.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Let's go there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Her magic stuff.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's not a situation-- forgive me, Tarvis-- where we should split up and look at different places?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wouldn't mind that. Do we want to check out the rooms on the right and the left super fast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're the boss, boss.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We'll do whatever you say, Tarvis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll move to the door where the guard keeps walking outside and crouch underneath one of the windows. If he comes in, he's dead. And I'll let Delweth go with Devan, and Dren goes with Obby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are we going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One can check out the library and one can check out the tea room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, who's going to the library, to the right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me and Dren are going to the library.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. All right, you head in there. First of all, you, Tarvis, look out the window. It's not a man. It's a woman. It's a large woman, with shock white hair and massive arms.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Armed? She'll die.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: She's got massive arms?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Well she's got a cloak with a hood, and you can see the hair spilling out. She looked right at the house a moment ago, but she didn't look at you. She just glanced over--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it look like she's standing sentry and doing a guardsman?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and you can even see further in the distance, like another 60 feet away is a gate to the rest of the city, out of her grounds. You can barely, in this heavy rain, see two more guys, standing on the other side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be quick about it. Search, come back, and let's move on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you guys split off to the library?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can see in here. It's totally dark, but bookshelves curve all the way around the entirety of this room. There's one of those rolling ladders that slides along to reach the books on the top shelf. There's a nice loveseat with a small side table next to it. There's a book, open, upside down, on the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll do a perception check to see if there is anything out of the ordinary or weird? 18.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do notice wedged amongst all the books of history, philosophy, and arcana one erotic novel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I pick it up. I give it to Dren. And I say: maybe you can use this, not for me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Meanwhile, in the tea room, it is also really dark in here. It's you two?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a little rolling tea table with sugar bowl and all the stuff. There's also, what's the word? Not an armoire--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: A buffet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what it is! A buffet with a couple of silver platters placed neatly for presentational purpose. Looks like a presenting room or sitting room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Delweth, do you want me to cast some dazzling lights?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You know what, let's leave it for now. Save it. Let's look around. I mean, you can't look around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You hear a woman's voice sneeze outside the window.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Quiet.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Outside one of the porthole windows?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, not right outside it, a little ways away. Through the heavy sound of the rain.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I approach the window very stealthily?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The one in here? Sure.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And take a little peek out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's the thing, Delweth. I don't know why we're not friends. I mean, I didn't really do anything to hurt the Clasp. In fact, I'm just helping you guys!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Devan, I understand that you might have a problem with gambling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, that's pretty innocent, really.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I know a lot about addiction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sex-a-holic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have a book for you later.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So, as much as I'd like to, it's difficult for me to trust you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: But I think if we both get out of this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we will!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I think we'll be fine. All right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll be friends afterwards.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So here's the thing. I know what you're going through. I'm going to do whatever I can to help you. All right? But that's between us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Audience, she said that she's going to do whatever she can to help you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Let's go back out. I think. Are there any drawers on the buffet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure there are. There's silverware, napkins, really nice napkins, and tablecloths.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Any turkey carving knives or anything nice like that? Turkey carving knife. Might need it for later. You never know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You all have your weapons, so I'm going to say you guys took a couple minutes earlier to yank them out of the monstrosity downstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We rejoin the group.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Stay close to me. This is going to get dangerous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well there was--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nothing! There was nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was a ladder on wheels that could be the source of farcical comedy and hijinks. But not tonight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you two?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There was nothing. I heard someone sneeze outside. It might be even the same person that was walking in the front. But nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I quickly check the window to make sure she still has her back to us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, she's picking her nose quite vigorously right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We make our way to the stairs that lead to the second floor.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There are two sets. Which one do you want to go up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They go to the same place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're identical, they're twin stairs going to the same destination. You can tell even from down here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The one on the right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You head up those stairs. I'll say you quietly move your way up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we would like to stealth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans) 13.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about a natural 20?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's two and two!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, was that stealth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Is that seven?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's seven. Nine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Obby actually slips under Tarvis' legs and then disappears through his cloak, and everyone loses track for a second. He's gone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got the whiff of some number twos.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're the doors to the hall. You also know that right over here, over your shoulder, is your old room. There's a guest bedroom across the hall.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sorry, so I can get a layout, how many doors?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coming up the stairs, you see double doors right in front of you. And then, you look over your shoulders, there's doors on the sides and behind you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got to be the double doors, right?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Where are we? What's ahead of us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the magic room.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Straight ahead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Upstairs is my grandma's room.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Where's your room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and there's a curving stairway directly behind you guys that goes to the third floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No interest in your room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She wouldn't have kept anything of mine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shouldn't we visit it for nostalgia?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have anything in there. She probably burned it all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's take a look.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How close were you at your closest to your grandma? When she took you in, did she bounce you on her knee?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no. I would say I was one step down from the cook?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So she didn't teach you anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No-- I mean she taught me some spells, and I do Dancing Lights, see? Just this is one. I take it away. She taught me some stuff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's see your room.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you taking them over to your room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take them over to the room. There's nothing in here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You open the door. You can't see into the dark. But you guys, looking in in the dim light, see nothing in this room except for furniture grouped together with sheets over it for storage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's an old Backstreet Boys poster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: *NSync, thank you very much!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach up and take the cloth that's hanging over a large portion of the furniture and I pull it off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a chaise lounge with two beautiful wooden chairs sitting on top of it. Not bedroom furniture at all.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Nothing else, just three pieces of furniture?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Under that sheet, yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Any other sheets?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two more.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. I pull off the second one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh my god, and you die.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A large table, and on top of the table, lying on its side, is a little dresser drawer.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Dresser drawers. I investigate the dresser drawers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You lift one drawer up, and it's empty.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's only one drawer?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'd say it was shoved in here for storage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I send a message over to Dren. How are you doing? I mean, are you okay?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I miss hanging out with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, I feel like we don't even get to talk any more.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, it's really dumb. It's nice being in your room, though!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We take the last tarp and pull it off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is another love seat like the one that you saw down in the library. It's identical, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take a dagger out and shove it in the cushions of the love seat and drag it across, open it up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stuffing pops out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No need for violence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those dogs get all over the place and ruin shit all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dogs? What dogs?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I know every child's got a secret hiding place in their room. So I want to perception check the room, the walls, if there's something, or the floors if there's a loose floorboard, somewhere.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do the roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I pick up two playing cards, one with Corey Feldman and one with Corey Haim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's empty. The room, the furniture wasn't even taking up that much space in here. It looks like Grandma cleared it out, and started storing shit in here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She does not give a shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, fine.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Uno. Perception.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ghosts, there's ghosts everywhere.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll leave this room, now. It's just a hallway and the funroom door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's stairs going up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, up to her place. But on this floor is the funroom. You know what?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Are there three other doors and the funroom? Or one other and the funroom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a guest room and then the funroom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if you can control yourself in the funroom, so I'm going to take the rope that I have, and I'm going to bind your hands behind your back before we go into the funroom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's pointless because I'm going to need my hands. If you want to get through the funroom, I'm going to need my hands!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can watch her, Tarvis. I'll make sure she doesn't do anything--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Dren, you said you wanted to tie her hands behind her back for me?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, Tarvis, that's what I said, sure. And I tie it, but really loose, but they don't see that, maybe?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck! Ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, you walk behind her and tie it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That looks a little loose. Tighten it up for me?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure, Tarvis, I'll tighten it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ow! That really hurt!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll actually say it's slightly above medium tight, because he couldn't see. Okay, what's up, guys?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going into this magic room, is that right?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Mage Hand the door, Mage Hand the lock, to perceive if it's open or go along the edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You twiddle your hand, your Mage Hand, all over it. You spend a minute doing it, because you're feeling nervous. Seems okay. You're thorough.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is it unlocked? Could I perceive if it was unlocked?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not locked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In this hallway and outside of the doors, are there any of those sigils?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No rats anywhere, except for Obby?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does the doorknob look different than a normal doorknob?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not a knob. It's one of those--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The levers?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Shall I Mage Hand the door?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I got it. I'll open the door. And I push it open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome back.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Balls!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Too late. Way late.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hope you're all having fun inside my house of horrors!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know what the fuck is happening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are paintings hanging all the way down, each more unsettling than the one before. A large fish skeleton hangs way down on the other end of the hall. It looks about fifteen feet long. Things right nearby that you spot: there are a crude pair of heavy black iron tongs; a unicorn fetus in a very large jar, pickled and curled in on itself; a set of eerie looking dolls, beautifully crafted but with no eyes, the front plate smashed in; stacks of books everywhere; a large stuffed bear rearing back, with a giant open snarl. Then all the way down the hall, you see ornate, gothic, creepy as fuck looking chandeliers. Three of them, evenly spaced down the hall and they look like cruel teeth pointed downward but they are gorgeous. They're stunning to look at. You almost don't know whether to shit or go blind. You don't know where to look; there's so much stuff. And you've seen this before. Most of it. There's new things here. Things you haven't seen, and you're overwhelmed, you're short-circuiting with all the things you're looking at around you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Devan, what do you remember?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I remember.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Close your eyes, what do you remember?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you remember?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I remember a shield.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shield?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You look over your shoulder, and you see that. There's two of them on the walls, to the side of both doors. They're black with a red barren tree in winter painted identically on each one hanging decoratively.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were the shields traps or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a very specific thing we have to do when we go down this hallway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, what is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well does somebody want to go over to the shield on the right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lift it up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will I die?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I lift it up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You place your hand, and you have to reach pretty high, but you get up on your tiptoes and reach and you push, and you feel it go (clunk).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Now what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bring it back down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You dig your nails onto the curve and (click) back to where it was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pull it down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Up down up down?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Left right left right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, I pull it down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (click)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, I think I'm doing something wrong.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Something with the left shield?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it was the one on the right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well this is just great, I'm glad we brought you here as our guide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, there's a second step. Can I look around, do I see a wall sconce?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no wall sconce? In the corner? Shit. She changed some stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We should kill her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! You still need--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I pull out my rapier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait guys! Hold on! We haven't even examined the whole room! Right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's useless to us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The wall sconce is hiding behind these books!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If we go deeper in the room you might see something!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll also remind you that there were two doors that she opened using blood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to keep her hand with us.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We could keep a vial of her blood!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just bring her hand with us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a lot easier if we take her with us, I feel like.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So what were you trying to do with the shield?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well I remember my grandma did some stuff, and things happened, and we had to do things in a very specific order, but she also said--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did you do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, these are so tight! I don't even know how my hand came out of it. I also remember her saying not to touch anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter) I can't imagine why.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beautiful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How big?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This big. A little bit bigger than a regular egg. A teapot made out of... it looks like bone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well I like this art better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't touch it! I keep looking for a wall sconce. Obby, when you touched the shield did you hear a click? Did you hear anything click?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Felt a click.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's look for the wall sconce!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're supposed to push up the shield and then tilt back a wall sconce or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You pull out a wall sconce, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pull out a wall sconce?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is there a holder for it behind one of the paintings maybe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we see anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can go look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A wall sconce.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The wall is smooth. There was a third step too; you remember what it was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where was the wall sconce?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel right where she's pointing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You give a knock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we need her blood. Dren, cut her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, there's more to do! Sheesh! Can I walk down the hallway?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look, if there's traps, then she'll get hit by them!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that what you're doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look for traps as I'm walking down the hall?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where were the shields? Were they at the bottom of the hallway from where we are?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, they were hanging up on the sides of the doors decoratively.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That we came in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the ones you came in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I also make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I check the floor for traps?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The floor, sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to check the shield to see if I can intuit how it works.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tarvis, you see poking out of the edge of the carpet-- you know how downstairs there was a long red carpet? There's one here as well. You see a bit of scrawl, something poking out of the edge of the rug about eight feet in front of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be careful of the rug. It's booby trapped!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp) Okay! Do I see a bowl? A plate anywhere? A bowl with water in it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not off-hand, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I, because I got a 17?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No bowl. You do see a really cool little brass and wood clockwork owl? That's cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That is cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we start opening things and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, don't touch anything!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well something needs to happen or we leave this room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Devan and I will go deeper into the room, and if anything goes screwy, we'll get hit by it, and then maybe we'll find that wall sconce!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, Dren, you stay here. Delweth will go with Devan.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Walking forward? Going down the hall?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I send a message to Dren--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk up to the little part of the carpet that has the little bit sticking out from under the carpet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do that before they walk off?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, before they go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, you peel it back; there is some sort of arcane scrawl on the floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like, scrawl?

lines.name: LIAM
